description.narrative: (Malawi): USAID's Health Communication for Life activity provides technical assistance to the Malawi Ministry of Health to design and implement social and behavior change strategies to increase positive healthy behaviors among Malawians. This activity will enable the Ministry to lead national social behavior change communication programming and will coordinate key USAID implementing partners in support of national efforts. In close coordination with the Ministry of Health, the activity conducts key health communication interventions to increase positive behaviors to combat malaria and improve maternal, neonatal, and child health; promote voluntary family planning and reproductive healthcare; reinforce preventive nutrition; and improve water, sanitation and hygiene practices. This activity will target socio-cultural practices that impede adoption of good health-seeking practices and behaviors using multi-channel social behavior change communication interventions including: (1) enhancing the capacity of Ministry staff; (2) scaling up the development of locally adapted and evidence-based social behavior change interventions to reach poor, marginalized, and vulnerable people (including adolescents and youth), to prevent diseases and foster positive health practices; and, (3) promoting open dialogue on gender dynamics among adolescents and mothers, including the involvement of male champions. By increasing health-seeking behaviors, the activity contributes to the accomplishment of the U.S. President's Malaria Initiative objectives and the Integrated Country Strategy Mission Objective 1.1 which seeks to improve social development..
